newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladeshi opposition legislators stage walkout.
newsitem.headline: Bangladeshi opposition legislators stage walkout.

text.p: Bangladesh's opposition legislators, led by former prime minister Begum Khaleda Zia, staged a walkout on Saturday when parliament resumed its session after a recess of about two months.

Members of Khaleda's Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP), the main opposition with 113 members in 530-seat parliament, and fundamentalist Jamaat-e-Islami left the floor after they were refused questions on the country's law and order situation by the speaker.
Khaleda accused the speaker of obstructing the opposition's efforts to speak on national issues.
Parliament officials said it was not clear whether the opposition lawmakers would return to the house later on Saturday.
